author: sky.cactus
content: The withdraw address keys should be kept far more secure than the validator keys.  This is because an attacker that gets your validator keys can only cause you to lose money, they cannot gain money (caveat for some edge cases).

author: sky.cactus
content: If someone has your withdraw keys, they can steal all of your stake.

author: sky.cactus
content: This means people are far more careful with how they store/secure their withdraw keys (for good reason), and the validator keys are just thrown onto a server and are generally not particularly protected most of the time.

author: sky.cactus
content:
For example, you may lock your withdraw keys in a box and bury it under a key and they may have never seen an online computer.

Your validator keys necessarily are on an internet connection computer at all times.

author: pietjepuk
content: You always have to sign messages with the private key. Rightfully the deposit tool did _not_ write out the private withdrawal key, or we would have had a lot more people having their funds stolen. It was also very clear about there being a distinction between hot/cold keys (signing / withdrawal keys), and that you needed to keep your mnemonic safe.
